Job Description
Le CRM Manager est responsable de la gestion, de l’optimisation et du développement des stratégies de relation client à travers les canaux digitaux (emailing, SMS, push notifications, etc.). Il/elle vise à améliorer la fidélisation client, augmenter la valeur client (CLV) et renforcer l’engagement.

Missions et responsabilités :Stratégie CRM :
Définir et piloter la stratégie CRM en lien avec les objectifs marketing et commerciaux.
Segmenter la base de données clients pour proposer des actions personnalisées et ciblées.
Mettre en place des parcours clients automatisés et personnalisés (marketing automation).
Outils et data :
Administrer la plateforme CRM (ex. : Salesforce, HubSpot, Adobe Campaign, etc.).
Coordonner la collecte, le nettoyage et l’analyse des données clients.
Travailler en lien avec les équipes Data et IT pour garantir la qualité des données.
Campagnes & reporting :
Concevoir, planifier et exécuter des campagnes CRM multicanal.
Analyser la performance des campagnes (taux d’ouverture, de clic, de conversion, etc.).
Proposer des optimisations continues sur les parcours clients et les messages.
Coordination :
Collaborer avec les équipes marketing, communication, produit, data et service client.
Assurer une veille concurrentielle sur les bonnes pratiques en matière de CRM et de fidélisation.
Profil recherché :Formation :
Bac +5 en marketing, digital, commerce ou data.
Expérience :
5 ans d’expérience en CRM, marketing relationnel ou digital marketing.
Compétences techniques :
Bonne connaissance des outils CRM (Salesforce, Adobe Campaign, etc.).
Maîtrise des outils d’emailing, marketing automation et de segmentation.
Bonnes bases en data (segmentation, KPIs CRM, RGPD, etc.).

intro: 500 Employees or more · Other Business Support Services
description:
Job Description
Our Purpose

Mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200+ countries and territories worldwide. Together with our customers, we’re helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. We support a wide range of digital payments choices, making transactions secure, simple, smart and accessible. Our technology and innovation, partnerships and networks combine to deliver a unique set of products and services that help people, businesses and governments realize their greatest potential.

Title and Summary

Managing Consultant, Services Business DevelopmentOverview
Services within Mastercard is responsible for acquiring, engaging, and retaining customers by managing fraud and risk, enhancing cybersecurity, and improving the digital payments experience. We provide value-added services and leverage expertise, data-driven insights, and execution.
Mastercard Advisors is a key differentiator for the company, providing cutting-edge services that help our customers achieve their objectives. Focused on big ideas which are scalable in a fast-paced business environment, we are responsible for end-to-end solutions for a diverse global customer base. Centered on data-driven technologies and innovation, our services include payments-focused consulting, loyalty and marketing programs, and data-driven analytic platforms.
Mastercard Advisors comprises of a diverse and dynamic team of experts who enjoy working in a goal-oriented and collaborative culture. As a member of our sales team, you will be on the frontlines - building excitement and generating demand for our unique services - while partnering with solutions experts to achieve the desired end. As part of the team, you will directly contribute to our customers’ success stories as well as to Mastercard’s positioning as a payments services leader.
Role
We are looking for a Managing Consultant to join the Northwest Francophone Africa Services team, to support business development with our key clients. These clients include Financial Institiutions, Fintechs and Retailers across our key markets in 23 countries including Tunisia, Algeria, Libya, Morocco, DRC, Cote d’Ivoire, Senegal, Cameroon,…
Key Responsibilities
• Together with existing team, support shaping Mastercard Services growth strategy in identified markets and execute against that strategy
• Lead cross-divisional sales efforts and projects by orchestrating work of local and regional sales, product and client services teams
• Identify the most critical aspects of problems clients or markets are facing to determine new business opportunities
• Build and leverage deep knowledge of all the Mastercard Advisors capabilities and how they fit together to create customized and relevant solutions for clients solving for their needs
• Leverage subject matter experts to develop best customized proposals for the clients
• Support the sales process from prospecting to executing commercial contracts and as well as continuously manage the sales pipeline
• Write well-structured and persuasive proposals and communicate with executives to pursue
• Develop and maintain strong professional relationships and partnerships with mid-level client management team
• Align efforts with Mastercard core team for sales success, including managing external obstacles and maintaining leadership alignment and support
• Partner with project teams to ensure projects’ quality and identification of follow-up sales opportunities
• Play a key role in creation of new Intellectual Capital and become “thought partner” for Clients
• Actively participate in recruiting, training and developing others
All About You:
• Consulting experience from a top-rated consulting firm desirable, as is payments/banking expertise and experience helping financial institutions at the executive leadership level
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills
• Excellent interpersonal skills
• Excellent analytical skills
• Solid track record of delivering on objectives
• Ability to work on a team or independently
• Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
• Entrepreneurial spirit and can-do attitude
• Advanced Word, Excel and PowerPoint skills
Undergraduate degree required
MBA or relevant post-graduate degree recommended
Candidates must be eligible to work in the country of which they are applying for a position in, as well as eligible to apply for travel visas as required by travel needs.
Corporate Security Responsibility


All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:

Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;

Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;

Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and

Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

Job Description:


Job Title: Account Executive
Location: Morocco, Marrakesh
Job Type: Full-time
About Dentsu International:


Dentsu is one of the largest marketing and advertising groups, providing a full suite of creative, data, technology and media services to its global clients in 145 countries.
We empower the world’s leading brands to create better creative and customer experiences with a focus on digital and creative transformation. We are champions for innovative marketing success across a diverse portfolio of fortune 100 companies, leading organisations and clients across key iconic brands advertising globally to maximise the value of our customer portfolios to drive hyper-personalised marketing and creative strategies.
Our combined strengths in creative excellence, customer digital transformation, media and enterprise marketing technology drives our competitive advantage. This includes a wide range of services to clients across media, advertising creative, PR, television format production, sports stadium advertising, talent and influencer engagement, app and website development, game development, programmatic advertising, IT consultancy, and data products, analytics and insight.
About the Client – Beiersdorf Morocco:


Beiersdorf AG is a global skincare leader, home to iconic brands such as NIVEA, Eucerin, La Prairie, Labello, Hansaplast, and Tesa. With 22,000+ employees in over 160 countries, they are focused on innovation, skin science, and helping people feel good in their skin.
The Role:


We’re looking for an experienced Account Executive to lead and manage the delivery of permanent and temporary POS and commercial print campaigns across Beiersdorf brands in Egypt. This is a fast-paced, client-facing role requiring strong project management, attention to detail, and commercial acumen.
Key Responsibilities:


End-to-end campaign and project management Client relationship management and exceptional service delivery On-site client visits and store checks as needed Collaboration with internal buying, creative, and production teams Supplier sourcing, negotiation, and procurement Ensuring projects are delivered on time, on budget, and to brief
What You’ll Bring:


Experience managing POS and print campaigns (essential) Background in FMCG, CPG, or consumer healthcare Strong project management and organisational skills Confident communicator and relationship builder Commercial mindset with strong Excel/data analysis skills Knowledge of creative/artwork and production processes Flexible, proactive and solutions-focused
What’s in it for you:


Annual bonus (based on performance & company profitability) Private health insurance for self and family. 3 wellness days Ongoing training via Dentsu University Internal mobility and MENA regional exposure A diverse, multicultural, and supportive team environment
Diversity and Inclusion:


Dentsu is committed to equity, inclusion and diversity. We believe bringing your whole self to work enables growth, innovation and stronger business outcomes. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds and experiences to apply.
Apply online now! If you meet the criteria, one of our recruiters will be in touch. If not this time, we’ll keep your profile in our talent pool for future opportunities.

Contract Type:

Description This cookie is native to PHP applications. The cookie stores and identifies a user's unique session ID to manage user sessions on the website. The cookie is a session cookie and will be deleted when all the browser windows are closed. Description The website's WordPress theme uses this cookie. It allows the website owner to implement or change the website's content in real-time. Description Amazon Web Services set this cookie for load balancing. Description New Relic uses this cookie to store a session identifier so that New Relic can monitor session counts for an application. Description This cookie is set by the Google recaptcha service to identify bots to protect the website against malicious spam attacks. Description This cookie is set by the Google recaptcha service to identify bots to protect the website against malicious spam attacks. Description This cookie is set by the Google recaptcha service to identify bots to protect the website against malicious spam attacks. Description This cookie is set by the Google recaptcha service to identify bots to protect the website against malicious spam attacks. Description Google Recaptcha service sets this cookie to identify bots to protect the website against malicious spam attacks. Description Polylang sets this cookie to remember the language the user selects when returning to the website and get the language information when unavailable in another way. Description The cookie ytidb::LAST\_RESULT\_ENTRY\_KEY is used by YouTube to store the last search result entry that was clicked by the user. This information is used to improve the user experience by providing more relevant search results in the future. Description YouTube sets this cookie to store the user's video preferences using embedded YouTube videos. Description The yt-player-headers-readable cookie is used by YouTube to store user preferences related to video playback and interface, enhancing the user's viewing experience. Description YouTube sets this cookie to store the user's video preferences using embedded YouTube videos. Description The yt-remote-session-app cookie is used by YouTube to store user preferences and information about the interface of the embedded YouTube video player. Description The yt-remote-cast-installed cookie is used to store the user's video player preferences using embedded YouTube video. Description The yt-remote-session-name cookie is used by YouTube to store the user's video player preferences using embedded YouTube video. Description The yt-remote-fast-check-period cookie is used by YouTube to store the user's video player preferences for embedded YouTube videos. Description Google Analytics sets this cookie to store and count page views. Description Google Analytics sets this cookie to calculate visitor, session and campaign data and track site usage for the site's analytics report. The cookie stores information anonymously and assigns a randomly generated number to recognise unique visitors. Description AWSALB is an application load balancer cookie set by Amazon Web Services to map the session to the target. Description Youtube sets this cookie to track the views of embedded videos on Youtube pages. Description YouTube sets this cookie to measure bandwidth, determining whether the user gets the new or old player interface. Description YouTube sets this cookie to store the user's cookie consent state for the current domain. Description Quantserve sets the mc cookie to track user behaviour on the website anonymously. Description The \_\_qca cookie is associated with Quantcast. This anonymous data helps us to better understand users' needs and customize the website accordingly. Description Zendesk set this cookie to create a unique ID for the session. This enables the website to collect data on visitor behaviour for statistical purposes. Description Description is currently not available.

Experience managing POS and print campaigns (essential) Background in FMCG, CPG, or consumer healthcare Strong project management and organisational skills Confident communicator and relationship builder Commercial mindset with strong Excel/data analysis skills Knowledge of creative/artwork and production processes Flexible, proactive and solutions-focused

Dentsu is one of the largest marketing and advertising groups, providing a full suite of creative, data, technology and media services to its global clients in 145 countries.
We empower the world’s leading brands to create better creative and customer experiences with a focus on digital and creative transformation. We are champions for innovative marketing success across a diverse portfolio of fortune 100 companies, leading organisations and clients across key iconic brands advertising globally to maximise the value of our customer portfolios to drive hyper-personalised marketing and creative strategies.
Our combined strengths in creative excellence, customer digital transformation, media and enterprise marketing technology drives our competitive advantage. This includes a wide range of services to clients across media, advertising creative, PR, television format production, sports stadium advertising, talent and influencer engagement, app and website development, game development, programmatic advertising, IT consultancy, and data products, analytics and insight.

Beiersdorf AG is a global skincare leader, home to iconic brands such as NIVEA, Eucerin, La Prairie, Labello, Hansaplast, and Tesa. With 22,000+ employees in over 160 countries, they are focused on innovation, skin science, and helping people feel good in their skin.

We’re looking for an experienced Account Executive to lead and manage the delivery of permanent and temporary POS and commercial print campaigns across Beiersdorf brands in Egypt. titre: Chef de projet Analyste ALM en Freelance Ref. 006014
description:
Job Description
Pour le compte de notre client, nous recherchons un Chef de projet Analyste ALM en Freelance pour la mise en place de la solution cible ALM. 

Durée de mission: 3 mois renouvelables (La durée prévisionnelle du projet est de 12 mois)
lieux: Casablanca Maroc
Démarrage: ASAP
Missions

Mise en place de la solution cible ALM dans le cadre du projet d’autonomisation
La principale mission est le renforcement du dispositif métier pour assurer l’aboutissement dudit projet, à travers les éléments suivants :
L’analyse de l’existant
Expression et définition du besoin et des processus cibles
Définition des règles métiers de calcul des métriques ALM
Définition des règles de gestion fonctionnelles
Validation du cahier des charges fonctionnel
Déroulement de la recette bancaire et homologation des Métriques et des reporting règlementaires.
Assistance post-démarrage en vue de la stabilisation du dispositif
Assurer une coordination avec les équipes ALM, IT et l’éditeur de l’outil.
Assurer la mise en œuvre et l’amélioration des calculs des métriques ALM (risque de taux, liquidité et change)
Participer à l’amélioration des processus de chargement des données et à la réduction du risque opérationnel (refonte d’une base Access et de certains traitements hors outils)
Rédiger la documentation fonctionnelle et technique des évolutions mises en place
Accompagnement des équipes ALM dans la conduite du changement, formation sur le nouveau dispositif tant sur le plan fonctionnel que technique, passation et démocratisation des outils mis en place
La participation active dans le projet d’autonomisation pour mettre en place une solution ALM permettant :
De maintenir à minima le standing des livrables ALM actuels, palier aux limites soulevées sur l’outil existant sous son actuelle configuration et de répondre et suivre les évolutions réglementaires dictées par Bank Al-Maghrib.
De répondre aux exigences réglementaires locales, aux exigences du pilotage ALM interne, en respectant les délais de livraison du projet.
Le calcul des indicateurs ALM, afin d’apprécier les expositions aux risques de liquidité, de taux et de change :
Calcul des gaps de liquidité en statique et en dynamique
Calcul des gaps de taux en statique
Calcul de la NPV et la sensibilité de la NPV aux chocs de taux
Calcul de la MNI budgétée (vision full dynamique) et de la sensibilité de la MNI au choc de taux
Calcul de la MNI bilan constant (vision semi-dynamique) et de la sensibilité de la MNI au choc de taux
Calcul des TCI stock, nécessaires à l’analyse de la rentabilité, à la maille :
Contrat : pour les produits contractuels
Agrégat : pour les produits non amortissables
De disposer de rapports de calcul ALM en stand-alone et en consolidé, maison-mère et filiale
De fournir un amortissement par nature de produit, par scénario sur la base d’une granularité contractuelle des données du bilan et hors bilan
De permettre un rapprochement de la donnée de gestion avec la donnée comptable dans un premier temps, puis générer les positions de réconciliation
D’assurer un processus d’alimentation automatique de la donnée de gestion & comptable dans l’outil ALM
De fournir des rapports d’analyse intra-situations (comparaison des situations inter-arrêtés, vue historique des agrégats, etc…)
de veiller à la Data Quality ALM :
Exhaustivité et fiabilité des données de gestion
Mise en place et fiabilisation des référentiels ALM (Market Data, statique Data,)
Suivi des ajustements Compta/Gestion et de la RCG
Mise en place de rapports et de contrôles permettant de s’assurer de la fiabilité des données de gestion avant et après intégration dans l’outil ALM
La mise en place de procédures ALM :
Mise en place des modes opératoires détaillés encadrant l’ensemble des processus de production et de contrôle des métriques ALM ;
Profil Recherché:

Un Chef de projet expert (plus de 10 ans d’expérience) ayant une forte expérience sur les projets ALM, de calcul de la MNI, et de pilotage de la liquidité du taux et de la position de change.
La maitrise des méthodologies projets est indispensable.
Diplômé d’un bac+5 d’une école de commerce ou d’ingénierie (option Finance), avec une expérience de 10 ans minimum au sein d’un client grand compte dans les secteurs de la Banque, Finance et / ou Assurance
Expérience confirmée en ALM avec une bonne maîtrise des modèles de calcul des risques structurels
Une connaissance de l’outil fusionrisk tant sur le plan fonctionnel que technique.
Une expérience en Gestion de projet agile ou cycle en V
Rigueur et sens de l’organisation
Anglais obligatoire
Sens du risque
Organisation et planification
Rigueur et fiabilité
Autonomie et capacité de proposition et d’anticipation.
Capacités relationnelles et aisance dans les échanges avec les diverses équipes. 
Maîtrise des outils d'automatisation des traitements de données et de publications des reporting (fonction d’Excel complexes, VBA, Python ou R, Access)
Expérience avérée dans la modélisation d’écoulement ALM
Maitrise de la valorisation des instruments financiers
Bonne connaissance des produits bancaires et financiers (dérivés, …),
Connaissance de l’environnement réglementaire et du contexte de marché
Autonomie, prise d'initiative et aptitude à gérer les priorités et respecter les délais
Bonnes qualités relationnelles, goût du travail en équipe, et qualité de dialogue
Attachement à la qualité du travail
Capacité d'analyse et de synthèse.
--

titre: PCC for Cluster West Rabat,North-West,Morocco + 1 more Finance Posted an hour ago
description:
Job Description
PCC for Cluster West


Rabat,North-West,Morocco Influence Business Case & FAS Planning Engage with CU Controller & Commercial to assess, identify & feedback relevant project financial performance & risks for opportunities in portfolio Sales Funnel Facilitate commercial & operational information required to support structuring for projects in scope Identify & address project portfolio control and performance related risks in Business Case (P/L, B/S & Cash Flow), ensuring ability to follow up during execution Engage with Operations during FAS Planning to ensure efficient breakdown of Business case into Fulfillment Assignment from a financial perspective for projects in scope Advice on the delivery plan prior to TG2 to optimize WCAP & Cashflow for projects in scope Control Financial Project performance Secure financial control is established within the project governance framework Analyze financial performance versus operational progress, advise & propose improvements for projects Identify & address deviations between budget, forecast & actuals, connect financial deviations to operational progress and identify actions as input to governance, reporting & forecasting for projects in scope Monitor & Control Cashflow & Working Capital assumptions against actuals, propose improvements & evaluate the need for loss provision for projects in scope Ensure financial risk management by identifying & quantify risks impacting the financial result, propose mitigations and evaluate the need for loss provision, for projects in scope Drive financial focus and actions for financial improvements in governance for projects in scope and drive timely financial closure for complete portfolio of projects
About this opportunity:


Project Controller (PC) is the financial portfolio expert of customer projects (FAS - Fulfillment Assignments) and opportunities. PC drives financial focus and secures financial improvements throughout lifecycle of opportunity to project, this includes ensuring efficient breakdown of business case into FAS from a financial perspective, regular monitoring of project financials through analytics & securing financial control is established within the project governance framework.
What you will do:


The skills you bring:


Solid knowledge of Ericsson core process & financial directives. Minimum 6 – 10 years of experience Excellent Risk management skills Core competence in influencing and driving change Good business understanding Relationship building skills
Join our Team

To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

titre: KAM Control and PCC Morocco Cluster Rabat,North-West,Morocco + 1 more Finance Posted an hour ago
description:
Job Description
KAM Control and PCC Morocco Cluster


Rabat,North-West,Morocco
About this opportunity:


We are looking for an experienced and dynamic KAM controller to drive strategic financial performance and planning of our business with major customers in CU WSA. In this role, you will oversee business performance, cost optimization, cash flow management, and profitability analysis while ensuring adherence to governance & compliance framework with financial regulations and risk management standards. You will act as a key business partner, collaborating with stakeholders while providing actionable insights to support fact based decision-making and execute speedily.
What you will do:


Drive governance and adherence to Finance Framework in the CU. Responsible for financial risk management in the CU. Engage in creating a “One Finance” mindset across the supporting Finance teams. Act as Finance Single Point of Contact (SPoC) to key stakeholders in the CU and during Audits Responsible for advising sales team in Presales for financial topics including cash flow, contract terms etc. Lead working capital management cycle including cash collection and customer management with Finance stakeholders including Treasury & trade finance activities. titre: Marketing Head Vaccines, Oncology & Specialty Care
description:
Job Description
As a Marketing Head Vaccines, Oncology & Specialty Care , you will play a key role and will be a member of the GSK Pharma Morocco Leadership Team. The role reports directly into Morocco GM.

You will head up the Marketing portfolio for the selected division through developing and implementing marketing strategies for current and future products to drive the business objectives and drive the LOC growth through Vaccines, Oncology and Specialty Care franchises.

This role is to set the ambition, identify, drive strategic business opportunities and implement in market launches with a customer-focused, data-driven, competitive mindset. This includes strategic planning, developing plans addressing high unmet needs with HCP, patients and channels activation with a strong governance This role will lead the strategic new products and Vaccines introduction in Moroccan market with a team of 4 colleagues.

This role will provide YOU the opportunity to lead key activities to progress YOUR career.  These responsibilities include some of the following:

Key Responsibilities

Lead, coach and manage the brand managers in the business unit to create a high-performance culture within the team to exceed the budgeted sales & profit targets
Lead the business unit to formulate & implement marketing strategies, aligning local marketing strategy with overall global strategy
Assess opportunities for new products and launch new products to maximize profitability.
Ensure successful implementation of new cross-functional ways of working for marketing in the Local Operating Company (LOC)
Conduct market research to uncover potential business opportunities in the market and ensure commercial viability
Launch new products where appropriate to contribute to the LOC growth
Ensure that all marketing activities adhere to promotion and marketing code to achieve performance with integrity
Plan and direct annual operating budget to maximize both short and long-term profitability
Responsible for financial planning and monthly forecasting into DRM cycle
Responsible for Brands P&L in line with Global/Regional strategic objectives
Ensure Sales Force Engagement in the portfolio, creating sales force’s understanding, knowledge, belief and motivation for brand strategy, drivers of growth and campaigns
Responsible for the development/management of market penetration strategies for the pharmaceutical market.
Cultivates the knowledge of key customers and competitors. Identifies brand growth opportunities.
 Interacts closely with sales force to make sure the understand and implement Product Marketing plan.
Markets the organisation’s products.
 Designs, develops and implements communication programs to advertise the organisation’s products using media (TV, radio, print, direct mail, the Internet), events, and sales promotions. Develops and evaluates pricing strategies and structures.
Why you

Basic Qualifications:
We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals:

Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Marketing, or related discipline
10 or more years in pharmaceutical sales & marketing
Experience with development of brand strategy
Experience with financial budgeting and forecasting
Experience in launch excellence
Considerable knowledge of marketing in Oncology & Specialty Care
Incisive analytical and strategic skills
Strong communication (written and oral) skills
Preferred Qualifications:
 
Agile and distributed decision-making – using evidence and applying judgement to balance pace, rigour and risk
High personal impact and credibility at senior Leadership Team level.
Commercial decision making and wining execution.
Demonstrated ability at making complex initiatives happen.
Managing individual and team performance.
Committed to delivering high quality results, overcoming challenges, focusing on what matters, execution.
Implementing change initiatives and leading change.
Sustaining energy and well-being, building resilience in teams.
Continuously looking for opportunities to learn, build skills and share learning both internally and externally.
Developing people and building a talent pipeline.
Translating strategy into action - a compelling narrative, motivating others, setting objectives and delegation.
Building strong relationships and collaboration, managing trusted stakeholder relationships internally and externally.
Budgeting and forecasting, commercial and financial acumen.
 Effective communication, including presentation skills.
Highly developed interpersonal networking skill at all levels.
Strong English proficiency.
Post Closure Date: 25/04/2025

Why GSK?

Uniting science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together.

GSK is a global biopharma company with a special purpose – to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together – so we can positively impact the health of billions of people and deliver stronger, more sustainable shareholder returns – as an organisation where people can thrive. We prevent and treat disease with vaccines, specialty and general medicines. We focus on the science of the immune system and the use of new platform and data technologies, investing in four core therapeutic areas (infectious diseases, HIV, respiratory/ immunology and oncology).

Our success absolutely depends on our people. While getting ahead of disease together is about our ambition for patients and shareholders, it’s also about making GSK a place where people can thrive. We want GSK to be a place where people feel inspired, encouraged and challenged to be the best they can be. A place where they can be themselves – feeling welcome, valued, and included. Where they can keep growing and look after their wellbeing. So, if you share our ambition, join us at this exciting moment in our journey to get Ahead Together.

Contact information:

You may apply for this position online by selecting the Apply now button.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

Job Description

Work under the direction of the Senior Emirates Official on duty, deploy Lounge Agents to optimum effect and ensure that the various service suppliers provide the expected level of service to Emirates Customers. Ensure all operational criteria is completed within specified time frame.
Job Outline:

Deploy available Emirates resources to best advantage in order to satisfy Customer and operational requirements arising during each duty period.
Ensure that service suppliers are fully briefed regarding EK requirements and that they deliver them in a timely and efficient manner so that the service handling proceeds smoothly and Emirates Customers' expectations are met or exceeded.
Control expenditure on food, beverages & other consumables in order to minimise waste and unnecessary costs while still meeting the needs of EK Customers. Identify any potential areas of development with product delivery and address this with the Airport Services Manager.
Respond to queries and complaints in an efficient and timely manner in order to restore passenger confidence. Ensure the expeditious and accurate completion of all reports & statistical data including Customer trends, meal wastage and recording of inwards goods & confirmation of invoices. Ensure completion of daily/weekly stock control.
Undertake various administrative functions and other duties as directed from time to time by the Airport Services Manager or senior station official on duty.
Ensure Lounge Agents are well motivated, groomed, given coaching/guidance and that they are able to perform their tasks in an efficient and professional manner to ensure a high level of customer service. Also provide required feedback into the lounge agents PM process.
In conjunction with the ASM, develop relationships with potential Airlines who may want to utilise the EK lounge for their Customers outside of EK operational flight hours.
In conjunction with the catering supplier conduct menu presentations and implement new or adjusted menu.
Conduct regular self-audit s to ensure Emirates specified standards on products, services, policies and procedures are followed consistently. Conduct various audits as directed by HQ and ensure timely reporting and corrective actions on non-conformance.
When required undertake and support operational and ticket desk duties and related admin duties.

Job Description
QUALIFICATIONS

University degree required
5+ years of experience in HR or Human Capital or People Development within a professional services firm
Passion for people development and learning
Experience in Learning, coaching or professional development
Great energy, drive, and entrepreneurship
Ability to work independently and collaboratively
Excellent organization capabilities, including the ability to initiate tasks independently and see them through to completion
Exceptional time management to meet your responsibilities in a complex and largely autonomous work environment
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (oral, written, and listening) with groups of varying sizes and at all levels, strong influencing capabilities. Ability to connect/collaborate with Partners, Consultants, and other Firm Support colleagues; ability to build consensus
Strong problem–solving skills and the flexibility to deal with uncertainty and obstacles in a fast-paced and quick-changing environment
Experience and confidence using It-based systems and tools
Comfortable with numbers, analysis, and systems


WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH

As a Learning Specialist, you will support in the execution and rollout of the Regional Learning strategy within EEMA, East Europe, Middle East & Africa with a special focus on Africa. This is a full-time position in Learning.
You will work closely with the Regional Heads of Learning, the local office Director of People (or a seasoned Professional Development Manager), EEMA Consulting teams, and other people stakeholders in your local office location and across the region.
You will report to the Senior Manager of EEMA Learning function. 

WHAT YOU'LL DO

In this role, you will perform a range of operational duties in support of learning programs. Specific responsibilities may include (but are not limited to) organization and delivery of (on-demand, virtual, in-person) programs, project management, process improvement, and program modification, assessment of program impact, and data management/analysis. Examples of regular tasks include managing program venue logistics, identifying and coordinating with faculty, managing communication, monitoring budget and processing invoices, and tracking feedback through surveys.  
In this role you will wear two hats, first one is regional responsibilities which include leading associate partners cohort. This includes developing AP-level colleagues cohort learning priorities and plans, defining learning objectives and needs, developing the learning calendar, and identifying channels to deliver the programs (e.g., Learning days, EEMA sessions, etc.). You will also work with the central AP learning team to ensure our programs are always using the latest knowledge and up to date on Firm approaches and materials for the cohort. Furthermore, you will work with the local office stakeholders to ensure every program is relevant and caters to local context and priorities.
In addition, you will be the upper tenure strategic lead and that includes reviewing the overall strategy and journey for TL transition to AP, and working closely with the TL cohort lead to integrate the learning journeys, experience and communications. You will also support the EEMA Learning Manager in the execution of the EEMA Regional Learning strategy, and contribute to EEMA Regional learning projects (e.g., program improvements/content updates, cross functional project teams with Firm Learning).
As for the second hat, you will have Africa Office responsibilities that includes supporting the Learning Manager in the design and rolling out of Personal Development Journeys for Africa Office, running for both Engagement Manager and Partner cohorts with external coaches, and taking the lead on all items related to delivery. You will also support the office and locations with local learning programming by being a thought partner on design and impact and enabling local teams to deliver local agendas by sharing best practice process and materials and collaborating closely to ensure a complimentary learning agenda to the regional and Firm ones that best manages shared resources.

Job Description
QUALIFICATIONS

University degree required
5+ years of experience in HR or Human Capital or People Development within a professional services firm
Passion for people development and learning
Experience in Learning, coaching or professional development
Great energy, drive, and entrepreneurship
Ability to work independently and collaboratively
Excellent organization capabilities, including the ability to initiate tasks independently and see them through to completion
Exceptional time management to meet your responsibilities in a complex and largely autonomous work environment
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (oral, written, and listening) with groups of varying sizes and at all levels, strong influencing capabilities. Ability to connect/collaborate with Partners, Consultants, and other Firm Support colleagues; ability to build consensus
Strong problem–solving skills and the flexibility to deal with uncertainty and obstacles in a fast-paced and quick-changing environment
Experience and confidence using It-based systems and tools
Comfortable with numbers, analysis, and systems


WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH

As a Learning Specialist, you will support in the execution and rollout of the Regional Learning strategy within EEMA, East Europe, Middle East & Africa with a special focus on Africa. This is a full-time position in Learning.
You will work closely with the Regional Heads of Learning, the local office Director of People (or a seasoned Professional Development Manager), EEMA Consulting teams, and other people stakeholders in your local office location and across the region.
You will report to the Senior Manager of EEMA Learning function. 

WHAT YOU'LL DO

In this role, you will perform a range of operational duties in support of learning programs. Specific responsibilities may include (but are not limited to) organization and delivery of (on-demand, virtual, in-person) programs, project management, process improvement, and program modification, assessment of program impact, and data management/analysis. Examples of regular tasks include managing program venue logistics, identifying and coordinating with faculty, managing communication, monitoring budget and processing invoices, and tracking feedback through surveys.  
In this role you will wear two hats, first one is regional responsibilities which include leading associate partners cohort. This includes developing AP-level colleagues cohort learning priorities and plans, defining learning objectives and needs, developing the learning calendar, and identifying channels to deliver the programs (e.g., Learning days, EEMA sessions, etc.). You will also work with the central AP learning team to ensure our programs are always using the latest knowledge and up to date on Firm approaches and materials for the cohort. Furthermore, you will work with the local office stakeholders to ensure every program is relevant and caters to local context and priorities.
In addition, you will be the upper tenure strategic lead and that includes reviewing the overall strategy and journey for TL transition to AP, and working closely with the TL cohort lead to integrate the learning journeys, experience and communications. You will also support the EEMA Learning Manager in the execution of the EEMA Regional Learning strategy, and contribute to EEMA Regional learning projects (e.g., program improvements/content updates, cross functional project teams with Firm Learning).
As for the second hat, you will have Africa Office responsibilities that includes supporting the Learning Manager in the design and rolling out of Personal Development Journeys for Africa Office, running for both Engagement Manager and Partner cohorts with external coaches, and taking the lead on all items related to delivery. You will also support the office and locations with local learning programming by being a thought partner on design and impact and enabling local teams to deliver local agendas by sharing best practice process and materials and collaborating closely to ensure a complimentary learning agenda to the regional and Firm ones that best manages shared resources.

Job Description

Come to work each day with an inclusive and collaborative Business technology team! As a Software Engineer in AbbVie Business Technology Solutions (BTS), you’ll have opportunities to contribute to the digital transformation of a leading biopharma company, helping to create solutions that impact patients and their communities for the better.

***This is a hybrid role based in Worcester, MA***

The Information Research East group at the AbbVie supports a variety of data analytics and visualization workloads serving a community of scientists focusing on pharmaceutical R&D. This position offers the opportunity to work in a cross functional team of scientists and IT professionals in building the next generation of informatics platforms and analysis pipelines.
 
We are seeking an exceptional candidate with a background in programming, web development, and data analysis, particularly in support of the life sciences. The ideal candidate will excel in delivering adaptable and user-friendly web applications and data analysis pipelines that can evolve to meet scientists’ needs. Additionally, the successful candidate will have the ability to independently identify, engineer, and optimize new data, software, or technology solutions to address critical business requirements. A continuous drive to improve existing methods and processes is essential.

Responsibilities

Independently design and develop data, software, or technology solutions to answer scientific or business questions, demonstrating proficiency across a range of technologies related to programming languages, data integration, and data visualization and analysis.
Collaborate within a cross-functional team to successfully design, develop and maintain web applications tailored to custom business needs.
Work directly with researchers and scientists as an integral team member of in designing, prototyping/testing, and tuning data for analytics and visualizations.
Employee best practices into ensuring security and integrity of software solutions, safeguarding data and system operations.
Continuously seeks learning opportunities to stay updated with emerging web technologies and data analysis tools, applying innovative solutions to improve processes and outcomes.
Use AbbVie values to govern decisions, actions and behaviors, ensuring that work reflects our commitments to Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk while fostering Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & Collaboration.

Qualifications

Required:

Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field and at least 5 years of relevant experience OR Master’s degree in relevant field and at least 4 years of experience.
Comfortable working in a dynamic environment and developing flexible solutions to meet evolving requirements
Ability to work independently with strong time management skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with ability to communicate effectively with scientists, developers, application analysts, managers and IT professionals
Extensive experience with Python, including data analysis and scientific computing tools such pandas and NumPy
Strong understanding of Web app development, with rxperience in JavaScript, Typescript, or ReactJS
Good understanding of web application frameworks such as Flask or FastAPI
Experience with incorporating Generative AI techniques into custom software solutions
Familiarity with object-relational mappers (ORMs)
Good presentation, training, and documentation skills

Additional Information

Applicable only to applicants applying to a position in any location with pay disclosure requirements under state or local law: 


The compensation range described below is the range of possible base pay compensation that the Company believes in good faith it will pay for this role at the time of this posting based on the job grade for this position. Individual compensation paid within this range will depend on many factors including geographic location, and we may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick), medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees.

This job is eligible to participate in our short-term incentive programs. 


Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, incentive, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole and absolute discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole and absolute discretion, consistent with applicable law. 

AbbVie is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives, serving our community and embracing diversity and inclusion.  It is AbbVie’s policy to employ qualified persons of the greatest ability without discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, status as a protected veteran, or any other legally protected group status.

US & Puerto Rico only - to learn more, visit https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/equal-employment-opportunity-employer.html 

US & Puerto Rico applicants seeking a reasonable accommodation, click here to learn more:

https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/reasonable-accommodations.html

titre: Medical Physics Advisor Application Support (French-Speaker), Morocco (M/F)
description:
Job Description

We shape innovation in healthcare. For everyone. Wherever they are.

Siemens Healthineers' portfolio of innovative solutions plays a central role in clinical decision-making and the patient care journey. With a workforce of 71 000 passionate employees in over 70 countries, we push the boundaries of what is possible to help everyone live longer and healthier lives.

Are you looking to join an innovative company and become a part of transforming our healthcare system?

As part of the development of its activities, Varian Business Area is looking for the Medical Physics Advisor Application Support. This position will be based in Casablanca in Morocco.

Varian, a Siemens Healthineers Radiation Oncology Business Area, we bring together the world's best talent to realize our vision of a world without fear of cancer. Together, we work passionately to develop and deliver easy-to-use, efficient oncology solutions.

We are part of an incredible community of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists pushing the boundaries of what’s possible, to improve people’s lives around the world. We embrace a culture of inclusivity in which the power and potential of every individual can be unleashed. We spark ideas that lead to positive impact and continued success.

Job Summary:

The Medical Physics Advisor Application Support will advise and support the Application Support Team and customers within the assigned area of the latest most advanced medical physics Varian related knowledge to provide customers the highest level of training.Make sure they are confident in operating their Varian equipment in a safe and efficient way and maximize their satisfaction.

Your Tasks and Responsibilities:

Define, in close cooperation with the Zone Manager Applications Support, the business and staffing needs (in the assigned area), to ensure that a safe and optimal medical physics support is provided to our customers with corporate guidelines and EMEIA rules on medical equipment safety
Promote and maintain a high degree of medical physics knowledge among the local Application Support personnel, for them to serve customers in the most effective manner by permanently keeping informed regarding all operating characteristics, design factors, technical performance and developments of Varian’s products
Perform remote and onsite customers trainings of Eclipse, IMRT/RA, SRT/SBRT, Brachytherapy and other/future medical physics related Varian product.
2nd level Support and assistance to Application Support physics and radiographers team on customer trainings.
Can participate in the development of classroom and on-site training concepts and programs for customers and Varian employees, to ensure the most effective courses are delivered to optimize customers’ and employees’ knowledge on Varian’s products
Cooperate with other departments within Varian to identify and address training needs on all current and new Varian physics products
Support Sales & Marketing on medical physics for road shows, sale support and conferences
Coordinate the allocation of Applications Support Physicist for testing of Varian products/prototypes and new applications systems as well as Customer Evaluation Testing activities.
Identify Medical Physics support requirements within the assigned area and cooperate with the zone lead manager and other departments, to ensure Applications Support Physicist are hired, trained, developed, and motivated to meet their current job responsibilities and the company’s future growth plans
Perform other duties as assigned
Minimum Required Skills and Knowledge:

Successfully completed degree in Medical Physics either master or Doctorate degree in medical physics.
Minimum of 10 years professional experience in the radio-oncology field with radiotherapy equipment
Minimum of 5 scientific articles published or conference presentations in an organization of national or international importance.
Thorough understanding of customers of the assigned area and their requirements
Excellent knowledge of training techniques and methodologies to train adults (hospital professionals)
Expert knowledge of processes and methods used in Varian’s product areas.
Expert knowledge of commissioning, QA and planning of IMRT/RA, SBRT/SRT, and Brachytherapy
Minimum of 8 Linacs commissioned: expert knowledge of Commissioning
Expert in Machine & patient QA
Other Requirements:

French, Arabic and English language, written and spoken.
Must be mature and tactful
Excellent interpersonal communication skills
Willing to travel extensively
Willing to work normal and non-normal hours as required to support the customers
Ability to train, advice and counsel Applications Support Specialists in technical matters
Ability to adapt and to integrate into, the customer’s technical/operational & safety environment Understanding of customer’s situation and related support needs
Ability to design and deliver trainings and workshop according to Varian standard od excellence
Excellent skills in applying VMS health & safety regulations to job holder’s work environment
GDPR

We care about your data privacy and take compliance with GDPR as well as other data protection legislation seriously. For this reason, we ask you not to send us your CV or resume by email. We ask instead that you create a profile in our talent community where you can upload your CV. Setting up a profile lets us know you are interested in career opportunities with us and makes it easy for us to send you an alert when relevant positions become open.

Diversity and Inclusion

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion are strong values that represent our company. We commit to studying all applications in accordance with these values and in full transparency.

Job Description
APM Terminals
APM Terminals plays an important role in enabling the global Maersk Ocean and Logistics network as well as serving other Shipping Lines, Beneficial Cargo Owners, Freight Forwarders, intermodal logistics providers and integrating with a wide variety of local port authorities, customs and government bodies across our global network of transshipment, import and export gateway terminals.

In support of the broader Maersk strategy, we are accelerating the transformation of our business from a portfolio of independently operated terminals into a safer, better, bigger global terminals operator
  
Key responsibilities: 


SAFETY  
• Ensure all planned preventive and corrective maintenance and breakdown response activities are executed safely with the aim of reducing risks to as low as reasonably possible 
•  Ensure the safety of all technicians working within their team, leading by example in their own behaviours and practices  
• Ensure all equipment under their responsibility is maintained in accordance with local legislation and standards specified by company global functions  
• Protect oneself and those around from unsafe acts. 
• Alert to risks and unsafe acts that could result in an accident. 
• Understand and follow the company’s safety system and participates in safety walks and HSSE initiatives 
• Ensure the safety of Equipment by spotting all hazards and implementing the necessary countermeasures. 
PERFORMANCE 
• Ensure all preventive maintenance, predictive maintenance and inspection activities are completed efficiently based on calendar, running hours, condition etc  
• Ensure equipment breakdowns are managed effectively based on their priority 
• Ensure KPIs for equipment availability, reliability, cost etc are met for equipment under their responsibility 
• Ensure all required equipment KPIs and measures are correctly recorded and reported as required 
Develop a system for cleaning, repair, and maintenance of Equipment. 

STRATEGY  
• Ensure maintenance strategies are developed for all equipment under the responsibility of the Equipment Manager, including all minimum requirements specified by Global Asset Maintenance. 
• Lead the continuous review and improvement of equipment maintenance strategies for equipment under their ownership, considering major and repetitive equipment failures. 
• Participate in the development of policies and procedures that affect the use of supplies 
• Contribute to the goals of the company. 
• Follow the company Code of Conduct 

ASSET INTEGRITY  
• Accountable for ensuring the integrity of all equipment under their ownership, considering the age and service of equipment, through development and execution of appropriate preventive, predictive and inspection activities  
• Manage a risk-based approach to pending corrective maintenance, considering the compounded risk to safety and operation through multiple failures or defects  

RESOURCE MANAGEMENT  
• Ensure the most efficient use of their team, working closely with the Work Planner and Scheduler to ensure work is planned accurately and scheduled realistically  
• Manage contracts for outsourcing of services or specialist activities as required  
• Manage spare parts inventory requirements for all equipment under their ownership  

PEOPLE/COMMUNICATIONS 

• Ensure their team have all necessary skills and competencies required to perform their normal duties 
• Evaluate the work quality of his staff and other subordinates for its operation. 
• Develop the skills and competencies of their team members, considering succession planning and career progression where relevant 
• Recruiting facilities service staff and training them appropriately to ensure competent work output. 

COST MANAGEMENT 
• Develop budgets for all planned preventive and corrective maintenance and typical breakdowns on equipment under their control  
• Proactively track and manage cost of maintenance for their equipment, intervening when costs escalate and identifying ways to reduce costs

We are looking for: 
•    Engineering or Technical degree from an Accredited university.  
•    Minimum 7-10 years’ experience in an operational Asset Maintenance. 
•    Strong leadership and motivational skills  
•    Works office hours Monday through Friday – weekend and overtime as required 
•    Maintains high energy levels over long periods of time 
•    Experience in a strong service oriented, stakeholder-management focused environment  
•    Understanding of Asset Maintenance planning metrics, principles, its processes and requirements Practical, planning and work scheduling capabilities, ready to improve and challenge the status quo  
Understanding of CMMS (IFS) software data systems and other software.  
•    Structured, driven, self-motivating, result orientated Highly disciplined  
•    Following through on actions and ensuring necessary documentation  
•    High quality awareness and ability to work with constant care  
•    Sensitive to cultural diversity and experience in a multicultural environment, with respect to employees, local authorities, and other stakeholders  
•    Strong communication skills and ability to influence  
•    Excellent English written and verbal communication 
•    Has a continuous improvement mindset 

  
Please note that only resumes submitted in English will be considered.  

•    #LI-POST
•    #LI-KE1

Maersk is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we embrace different styles of thinking. Maersk is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applicants without regard to race, colour, gender, sex, age, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy or parental leave, veteran status, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.

We are happy to support your need for any adjustments during the application and hiring process. If you need special assistance or an accommodation to use our website, apply for a position, or to perform a job, please contact us by emailing  accommodationrequests@maersk.com.

• Proactively track and manage cost of maintenance for their equipment, intervening when costs escalate and identifying ways to reduce costs

We are looking for: 
•    Engineering or Technical degree from an Accredited university.  
•    Minimum 7-10 years’ experience in an operational Asset Maintenance. 
•    Strong leadership and motivational skills  
•    Works office hours Monday through Friday – weekend and overtime as required 
•    Maintains high energy levels over long periods of time 
•    Experience in a strong service oriented, stakeholder-management focused environment  
•    Understanding of Asset Maintenance planning metrics, principles, its processes and requirements Practical, planning and work scheduling capabilities, ready to improve and challenge the status quo  
Understanding of CMMS (IFS) software data systems and other software.  
•    Structured, driven, self-motivating, result orientated Highly disciplined  
•    Following through on actions and ensuring necessary documentation  
•    High quality awareness and ability to work with constant care  
•    Sensitive to cultural diversity and experience in a multicultural environment, with respect to employees, local authorities, and other stakeholders  
•    Strong communication skills and ability to influence  
•    Excellent English written and verbal communication 
•    Has a continuous improvement mindset 

  
Please note that only resumes submitted in English will be considered.

Maersk is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we embrace different styles of thinking. Maersk is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applicants without regard to race, colour, gender, sex, age, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy or parental leave, veteran status, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.

We are happy to support your need for any adjustments during the application and hiring process. If you need special assistance or an accommodation to use our website, apply for a position, or to perform a job, please contact us by emailing  accommodationrequests@maersk.com.

Job Description
ABOUT UNILEVER

With 3.4 billion people in over 190 countries using our products every day, Unilever is a business that makes a real impact on the world. Work on brands that are loved and improve the lives of our consumers and the communities around us. We are driven by our purpose: to make sustainable living commonplace, and it is our belief that doing business the right way drives superior performance. At the heart of what we do is our people – we believe that when our people work with purpose, we will create a better business and a better world.

At Unilever, your career will be a unique journey, grounded in our inclusive, collaborative, and flexible working environment. We don’t believe in the ‘one size fits all’ approach and instead we will equip you with the tools you need to shape your own future.

<CATEGORY/FUNCTION INTRODUCTION>

< The Logistics Assistant Manager will play a pivotal role in overseeing the transportation, warehousing, registration, and import/export operations within Unilever. This position requires a detail-oriented individual with strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently. The successful candidate will collaborate with various departments to ensure seamless logistics operations that align with Unilever’s strategic goals.

>

JOB PURPOSE

Unilever is the place where you can bring your purpose to life with the work that you do – creating a better business and a better world.  If you are <include role’s purpose referring to why the role exists> then this role is just for you!

WHAT WILL YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES BE

Transportation Management

Coordinate and oversee all transportation activities, ensuring timely delivery of goods.
Develop and implement efficient routing plans to optimize transportation costs.
Ensure compliance with transportation regulations and safety standards.
Warehousing Operations

Oversee warehousing activities including inventory management, order fulfillment, and storage optimization
Implement best practices for warehousing processes to enhance efficiency and reduce costs.
Collaborate with the warehouse team to maintain accurate inventory records and minimize discrepancies.
Ensure compliance with safety regulations & quality standards within the warehouse environment
Import/Export Coordination

Facilitate all import/export activities in compliance with international trade regulations.
Liaise with freight forwarders, customs brokers, and regulatory agencies to resolve any issues related to shipments.
Monitor shipment status and communicate updates to relevant stakeholders.
Registration Management

Ensure proper registration of products as required by local regulations
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of regulatory changes affecting logistics operations.
Collaborate with legal teams to ensure compliance with all applicable laws regarding product registration.
Team Leadership

Assist in managing a team of logistics professionals, providing guidance and support as needed.
Foster a collaborative work environment that encourages continuous improvement and innovation.
Cost & Savings Projects: Identify areas for process improvement and cost optimization within logistics operations.

WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED

Experiences & Qualifications

Educational Background: A bachelor’s degree in Logistics /Supply Chain is preferred.
Experience Requirement: 4 to 6 years of experience in logistics or customer service roles is essential.
competences:
Skills

Analytical Skills: Strong analytical abilities to assess data and make informed decisions regarding logistics processes.
Communication Skills: Excellent communication skills are necessary for effective interaction with stakeholders, including customers, shipping lines, freight forwarders, and internal teams.
Negotiation Skills: Proficiency in negotiation techniques to secure favorable terms with suppliers and partners.
Organizational Skills: Strong organizational capabilities to manage multiple tasks efficiently while maintaining attention to detail.
Leadership

You are energized by delivering fantastic results. You are an example to others – both your results and your resilience. You are constantly on the lookout for better ways to do things, engaging and collaborating with others along the way.
As an individual you are the one responsible for your own wellbeing and delivering high standards of work. You must also focus on the Consumer and what they need. You are humble and have your head up, looking around to interpret evidence and data smartly, spot issues and opportunities to make things better.
Critical SOL (Standards of Leadership) Behaviors
PASSION FOR HIGH PERFORMANCE: Takes personal responsibility and accountability for execution and results. Has an owner’s mindset, using data and insight to make decisions.
PERSONAL MASTERY: Sets high standards for themselves. Actively builds own wellbeing and resilience.
CONSUMER LOVE: Whatever their role, always looks for better ways to serve consumers. Invests time inside and outside to understand the needs of consumers.
PURPOSE & SERVICE: Has humility, understanding that leadership is service to others, inside and outside Unilever.
AGILITY: Explores the world around them, continually learning and developing their skills.
Unilever embraces diversity and encourages applicants from all walks of life! This means giving full and fair consideration to all applicants and continuing development of all employees regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage and civil partnership, and pregnancy and maternity.

Unilever is an organisation committed to equity, inclusion and diversity to drive our business results and create a better future, every day, for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. At Unilever we are interested in every individual bringing their ‘Whole Self’ to work and this includes you! Thus if you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can support you through your recruitment journey.

description:
Job Description & Summary

Rejoignez-nous !
La raison d'être de PwC est de renforcer la confiance au sein de la société et d’apporter des solutions aux enjeux stratégiques de ses clients.
PwC développe au Maroc des missions d’audit, d’expertise comptable et de conseil (stratégie, management, transactions, juridique & fiscal) créatrices de valeur pour ses clients, privilégiant des approches sectorielles.
Plus de 325 000 personnes dans 152 pays à travers le réseau PwC partagent idées, expertises et perspectives innovantes au bénéfice de la qualité de service pour leurs clients et partenaires.
Au Maroc, PwC compte plus de 300 collaborateurs.Rejoignez l’équipe Deals et accompagnez les plus grands investisseurs financiers et stratégiques dans la réalisation de leurs acquisitions ou cessions.
Le pôle Deals de PwC, constitué au Maroc d'environ 25 professionnels expérimentés, s’appuie sur un réseau mondial Deals actif dans 70 pays. Cette practice, qui réunit des expertises complémentaires (Transaction Services, Optimisation de financement et accompagnement dans un contexte "distressed", corporate finance, évaluation), nous permet ainsi de garantir la réussite des projets de nos clients.

Notre équipe intervient notamment auprès de nos clients et les accompagne pour répondre aux spécificités de leurs projets de croissance externe (due diligence acheteur), mais également dans le cadre de processus de cession d’une filiale ou d’une participation (due diligence vendeur, assistance vendeur), ou lors de projets de recherche de financement ou de M&A dans un contexte "distressed". Cette équipe vous permettra d’effectuer des missions variées, aussi bien sur des transactions au Maroc, que sur des deals transfrontaliers (en étroite collaboration notamment avec le bureau PwC de Paris).





Ce que vous pouvez attendre :
- Etre exposé (e) à des environnements internationaux et stimulants, et participer à des deals transfrontaliers

- Analyser les performances historiques et futures d’une cible et identifier les zones de risques associées

- Challenger les éléments de valorisation

- Collaborer avec une grande variété d’interlocuteurs : directeurs financiers, fonds d’investissement, avocats, banquiers d’affaires, consultants en stratégie, fiscalistes, etc.

- Accompagner vos clients dans leurs prises de décisions, en tant qu’ interlocuteur autonome sur vos sujets

- Encadrer les analystes plus juniors/ stagiaires pendant vos missions, les évaluer et les conseiller dans leurs évolutions de carrière

- Avoir une carrière stimulante avec des expériences techniques et humaines de qualité

Ce que nous attendons de vous :

· Vous êtes diplômé (e) d’une grande école de commerce ou d’ingénieur

· Vous vous êtes construit une expérience en finance d’entreprise pendant vos stages ou lors d’expériences précédentes (ex. audit, M&A, Private Equity, contrôle de gestion)

· Votre niveau d’anglais est impérativement courant, à l’écrit comme à l’oral

· Vous êtes curieux (se), rigoureux (se) et savez faire preuve d’agilité

· Vous alliez capacités analytiques, techniques, esprit de synthèse et sens business

· Vous avez le goût du travail en équipe et le sens du service client





Education (if blank, degree and/or field of study not specified)

Degrees/Field of Study required:Degrees/Field of Study preferred:
Certifications (if blank, certifications not specified)
competences:
Required Skills

Optional Skills

Accepting Feedback, Accepting Feedback, Active Listening, Alteryx (Automation Platform), Analytical Thinking, Budget Analysis, Business Valuations, Carve-Outs, Cash Flow Analysis, Communication, Conducting Research, Contractual Risk Mitigation, Creativity, Data Analysis, Data Analysis and Interpretation, Data Analytics, Data Integrity, Deal Structures, Draft Preparation, Due Diligence Research, Earnings Quality, Embracing Change, Emotional Regulation, Empathy, Ensuring Compliance With Accounting Standards {+ 38 more}
Desired Languages (If blank, desired languages not specified)

Travel Requirements

Not Specified
Available for Work Visa Sponsorship?

No
Government Clearance Required?

No
Job Posting End Date
